channel.title: SQL Help
channel.description:
I'm am not that great with setting up things to connect to a database via mysql. I'm trying to setup a login system and I'm getting this error: [code] Access denied for user 'root'@'localhost' (using password: NO)[/code] I have a question though, when it asks for the IP of the database, host, or whatever it's called, what do I put there? Because I've seen most people use 'localhost', then some have said to use the actual website IP, and I've also seen some people use a remote mysql IP.
This is what I'm using to connect to the database on my host: [code] $connect = mysql_connect("localhost", "root", "password?"); mysql_select_db("database name");[/code] I know what to put in the second line, but what exactly do I put in the first line? Any help is highly appreciated.
Edit: I already have a database and table setup for this.

item.title: SQL Help
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It depends. Is mysqld ran on the same server as the web server?

Your error is because you’re not supplying a password for the account. I would also highly recommend against using root in production code. Create a separate user that only has the permissions required to carry out its task.
